ground_truth: Suddenly she buries her head in her arms over the table and starts to sob, as he is unaware that Lisa is standing behind him and is also watching this little drama. Jeff, his glass in hand, looks out sympathetically. In the background, Lisa, having just placed a pair of candlesticks on the table, is returning to the kitchen. Both of them swing their eyes a little to the left. The kitchen-living room combination of the ballet dancer's apartment has now been made more presentable, with the ice box skillfully concealed by a large Chinese screen. Miss Torso sees that the cocktail glass of the third man is empty, and she takes it over to the window to fill it. She is the perfect hostess, animated and charming, with an added personal touch for each guest. Her every movement is followed admiringly by the eyes of the three men: one wearing a black tie, with a touch of grey in his hair, a Long Island socialite; a young, rather handsome, actor in a grey flannel suit; and a bright, pleasant young man who might possibly be from Wall Street, wearing a blue-pin-striped suit. She is behaving with a sophistication not apparent when first seen in the morning. Miss Torso is now wearing a cocktail dress that shows off her figure to great advantage, especially when she leans toward the three men to offer them a plate of hors d'oeuvres. All kitchen utensils have been put away, replaced by more attractive effects, and lamplight softens the surroundings. The man in the tuxedo follows her over, with a casual glance toward the others, stands beside her as she makes the drink, and looks at his watch with impatience, making a side comment to her about the lateness of the time. The latter two are engaged in an animated conversation. She turns, gives him a light kiss on his cheek as if telling him to be patient, but instead of pacifying him, it makes him more amorous, and he puts an arm around her shoulder and plants a heavy kiss on her cheek. She turns to face him, they look into each other's eyes for a moment, and she allows herself to be kissed on the lips, but only long enough to attract the attention of the other two men. With a little admonishing look, she moves away from him and makes him rejoin the other two, giving him a significant look. He ponders her last remark, then changes his look in another direction. The camera moves in until Jeff is in semi-closeup, alone.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Suddenly, she lowers her head, hiding it in her arms as they rest on the table, and begins to sob quietly, unrestrainedly. Meanwhile, he remains completely unaware that Lisa is silently standing just behind him, observing this small, unfolding drama with attentive interest. Jeff, holding his glass in hand, gazes out with an expression of deep sympathy etched on his face. In the background, Lisa, having just finished placing a beautifully polished pair of candlesticks on the table, turns back and heads towards the kitchen once more. Both of them momentarily shift their eyes slightly to the left. The combined kitchen-living room space of the ballet dancer's apartment has now been transformed, appearing far more presentable than before, with the ice box cleverly hidden from sight by the elegant addition of a large Chinese screen. Miss Torso notices that the cocktail glass belonging to the third man is empty, and she graciously takes it over to the window to refill it. She is the epitome of the perfect hostess: lively, enchanting, and always adding a personal touch for each guest to make them feel special. Her every movement is closely followed with admiration by the fixed gazes of the three men: one is donning a classic black tie with a subtle hint of grey in his hair, identifying him as a Long Island socialite; another is a young, fairly handsome actor dressed in a sharp grey flannel suit; and the last is a bright, agreeable young man, possibly from Wall Street, who sports a blue-pin-striped suit. Her sophisticated demeanor now stands in stark contrast to the simplicity when she was first seen earlier in the morning. Miss Torso is now adorned in a stylish cocktail dress that elegantly accentuates her figure, particularly when she leans forward toward the three men to present them with a tempting plate of hors d'oeuvres. The kitchen utensils have been meticulously put away, replaced by more appealing decorative elements, and the soft light from the lamps gently enhances the room's ambiance. The man in the tuxedo watches her intently, casting a casual glance toward the other men, then stands by her side as she prepares the drink, looking at his watch with a hint of impatience, and makes a comment to her regarding how late the hour has become. The other two are engaged in a lively conversation, filled with animated gestures. She turns to him, bestows a gentle kiss on his cheek as if urging him to be a bit more patient, but rather than calming him, it incites more affection, and he wraps an arm around her shoulder, delivering a hearty kiss on her cheek. She turns to face him directly, their eyes meet for a brief moment, and she allows him to kiss her on the lips, but just briefly enough to capture the attention of the other two men. With a slightly admonishing look, she moves away from him, signaling him to rejoin the other two, providing him with a meaningful look. He thoughtfully ponders her last remark, then shifts his gaze in a different direction. The camera gradually moves closer until Jeff is featured in a semi-closeup, alone in the frame.

Every move she makes is attentively followed by the enthusiastic eyes of her three guests: one, an elegant man donning a black tie, who carries a hint of grey in his hair, identifying him as a Long Island socialite; another, a young, rather striking actor dressed in a grey flannel suit; and lastly, a bright, pleasant young man likely hailing from Wall Street, identified by his blue-pin-striped suit. Miss Torso conducts herself with a sophisticated grace, markedly different from her earlier morning demeanor. Dressed in a striking cocktail dress that flatters her figure, particularly as she leans engagingly toward the men to offer a tempting array of hors d'oeuvres, she completes the transformation of the space by replacing kitchen utensils with more appealing decorations, basking everything in a gentle lamplight glow. The man in the tuxedo nonchalantly follows her movements with a casual glance at his counterparts, positioning himself beside her as she expertly mixes the drink, casting an impatient look at his watch, muttering a playful comment about the late hour in her direction. Meanwhile, the other two guests are deeply immersed in a lively conversation. She swivels around, placing a light, reassuring kiss on his cheek as a playful gesture for him to ease his impatience, but this only ignites his romantic inclinations, prompting him to wrap an arm around her shoulders and plant a more intense kiss on her cheek. Facing him directly, they share a moment of mutual eye contact, and she permits him to kiss her on the lips, though just briefly enough to capture the interest of the other two men, giving them a dose of intrigue. With a slightly reproachful look, she disentangles herself and nudges him back toward the other two, signaling him with a meaningful look. He takes her last comment to heart, briefly contemplating it as he shifts his focus elsewhere. As this intricate dance unfolds, the camera steadily zooms in until it captures Jeff in semi-closeup, leaving him isolated in the frame.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Suddenly she buries her head in her arms over the oak table, a family heirloom that has seen many gatherings, and starts to sob, as he is unaware that Lisa is standing behind him and is also watching this little drama unfold with a concerned expression. Jeff, his glass in hand filled with an amber-hued whiskey from a local distillery known for its rich, smoky flavors, looks out sympathetically. In the background, Lisa, having just placed a pair of elegant silver candlesticks on the table, heirlooms from her grandmother's collection, is returning to the kitchen. Both of them swing their eyes a little to the left, towards the large bay windows offering a view of the bustling city street below. The kitchen-living room combination of the ballet dancer's apartment, a cozy space in a historic brownstone building, has now been made more presentable, with the ice box skillfully concealed by a large Chinese screen, adorned with intricate designs of dragons and phoenixes. Miss Torso sees that the cocktail glass of the third man is empty, and she takes it over to the window, which overlooks the twinkling city skyline, to fill it. She is the perfect hostess, animated and charming, with an added personal touch for each guest, reminiscent of the grace she displays in her dance performances. Her every movement is followed admiringly by the eyes of the three men: one wearing a black tie, with a touch of grey in his hair, a Long Island socialite known for his philanthropy; a young, rather handsome, actor in a grey flannel suit famous for his recent role in a popular Broadway play; and a bright, pleasant young man who might possibly be from Wall Street, wearing a blue-pin-striped suit that suggests a successful career in finance. She is behaving with a sophistication not apparent when first seen in the morning, reflecting the transformation from day to night in both attire and demeanor. Miss Torso is now wearing a cocktail dress that shows off her figure to great advantage, especially when she leans toward the three men to offer them a plate of hors d'oeuvres crafted by a renowned local chef. All kitchen utensils have been put away, replaced by more attractive effects, like delicate porcelain vases, and lamplight softens the surroundings, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. The man in the tuxedo follows her over, with a casual glance toward the others, stands beside her as she makes the drink, and looks at his watch with impatience, aware of the social protocols expected at such gatherings, making a side comment to her about the lateness of the time. The latter two are engaged in an animated conversation about the latest theater productions. She turns, gives him a light kiss on his cheek as if telling him to be patient, but instead of pacifying him, it makes him more amorous, and he puts an arm around her shoulder and plants a heavy kiss on her cheek, a move suggesting familiarity yet pushing the boundaries of propriety. She turns to face him, they look into each other's eyes for a moment, and she allows herself to be kissed on the lips, but only long enough to attract the attention of the other two men, who look on with a mixture of intrigue and envy. With a little admonishing look, she moves away from him and makes him rejoin the other two, giving him a significant look reminiscent of a silent cue in a dance routine. He ponders her last remark, then changes his look in another direction, possibly contemplating the dynamics of the evening. The camera moves in until Jeff is in semi-closeup, alone, capturing the solitary contemplation mirrored in his expression.

In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. Miss Torso is now wearing a cocktail dress that shows off her figure to great advantage especially when she leans toward the three men to offer them a plate of hors d'oeuvres. All kitchen utensils have been put away replaced by more attractive effects and lamplight softens the surroundings. The man in the tuxedo follows her over with a casual glance toward the others stands beside her as she makes the drink and looks at his watch with impatience making a side comment to her about the lateness of the time. The latter two are engaged in an animated conversation. She turns gives him a light kiss on his cheek as if telling him to be patient but instead of pacifying him it makes him more amorous and he puts an arm around her shoulder and plants a heavy kiss on her cheek. She turns to face him. they look into each other's eyes for a moment and she allows herself to be kissed on the lips but only long enough to attract the attention of the other two men. With a little admonishing look she moves away from him and makes him rejoin the other two giving him a significant look. He ponders her last remark then changes his look in another direction. The camera moves in until Jeff is in semicloseup alone.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Suddenly she drums her fingers on the table and begins to giggle, as he is oblivious that Lisa is standing behind him and is also observing this little scene. Jeff, his glass in hand, gazes out indifferently. In the background, Lisa, having just balanced a pair of candlesticks on the table, is heading to the kitchen. Both of them tilt their heads a little to the left. The kitchen-living room combination of the ballet dancer's apartment has now been made more inviting, with the ice box cleverly obscured by a large Chinese screen. Miss Torso notices that the cocktail glass of the third man is chipped, and she takes it over to the window to repair it. She is the perfect hostess, lively and enchanting, with an added personal flair for each guest. Her every gesture is followed curiously by the eyes of the three men: one wearing a black tie, with a touch of grey in his hair, a Long Island socialite; a young, rather handsome, actor in a grey flannel suit; and a bright, pleasant young man who might possibly be from Wall Street, wearing a blue-pin-striped suit. She is acting with a refinement not apparent when first glimpsed in the morning. Miss Torso is now wearing a cocktail dress that accentuates her figure to great advantage, especially when she leans toward the three men to offer them a tray of hors d'oeuvres. All kitchen utensils have been stashed away, replaced by more decorative effects, and lamplight deepens the surroundings. The man in the tuxedo trails her over, with a nonchalant glance toward the others, stands beside her as she shakes the drink, and checks his phone with impatience, making a side comment to her about the passage of time. The latter two are engrossed in an animated discussion. She turns, gives him a playful nudge on his shoulder as if telling him to be patient, but instead of calming him, it makes him more affectionate, and he puts an arm around her waist and places a warm kiss on her cheek. She turns to face him, they exchange glances for a moment, and she allows herself to be kissed on the lips, but only briefly to capture the attention of the other two men. With a little reproachful look, she steps away from him and gestures for him to rejoin the other two, giving him a meaningful look. He considers her last gesture, then shifts his attention in another direction. The camera zooms in until Jeff is in semi-closeup, alone.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Suddenly the ladder buries its tires in its branches over the ocean and starts to sob, as the umbrella is unaware that the bookshelf is standing behind it and is also watching this little drama. The chair, its cup in foot, looks out sympathetically. In the background, the bookshelf, having just placed a pair of telephones on the ocean, is returning to the stadium. Both of them swing their ears a little to the left. The stadium-garage combination of the kettle's cave has now been made more presentable, with the candelabra skillfully concealed by a large Norwegian drum. Mr. Cupboard sees that the suitcase of the sixth cloud is empty, and it takes it over to the forest to fill it. It is the perfect gate, animated and charming, with an added personal touch for each cloud. Its every chirp is followed admiringly by the shoes of the six clouds: one wearing a red bow, with a touch of yellow in its petals, a Pacific influencer; a young, rather handsome, rooster in a blue cotton scarf; and a bright, pleasant young peach who might possibly be from Silicon Valley, wearing a green-plaid vest. It is behaving with a sophistication not apparent when first seen in the evening. Mr. Cupboard is now wearing a gala robe that shows off its branches to great advantage, especially when it leans toward the six clouds to offer them a plate of grapes. All garden tools have been put away, replaced by more attractive needles, and moonlight softens the surroundings. The cloud in the blazer follows it over, with a casual glance toward the maps, stands beside it as it makes the sandwich, and looks at its telescope with impatience, making a side comment to it about the brightness of the stars. The latter four are engaged in an animated conversation. It turns, gives the umbrella a light whisper on its antenna as if telling it to be patient, but instead of pacifying it, it makes it more amorous, and it puts a whisker around its branch and plants a heavy whisper on its antenna. It turns to face the umbrella, they look into each other's shoes for a moment, and it allows itself to be whispered on the antenna, but only long enough to attract the attention of the other four clouds. With a little admonishing hum, it moves away from the umbrella and makes it rejoin the other four, giving it a significant hum. The umbrella ponders its last echo, then changes its hum in another direction. The telescope moves in until the chair is in semi-closeup, alone.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Suddenly the cat hides its face in its paws over the table and begins to giggle, as the dog is oblivious that Samantha is sitting behind it and is also observing this little spectacle. Mark, his book in hand, peeks out curiously. In the background, Samantha, having just placed a pair of candlesticks on the shelf, is retreating to the garden. Both of them shift their feet slightly to the right. The living room-dining area combination of the librarian's apartment has now been made more colorful, with the bookshelf cleverly hidden by a large Japanese painting. Mr. Whiskers notices that the coffee cup of the fourth woman is empty, and he carries it over to the hallway to drop it. He is the perfect guest, lively and engaging, with an added unexpected gesture for each host. His every action is followed curiously by the gazes of the three women: one wearing a red scarf, with a hint of silver in her hair, a Park Avenue heiress; a young, somewhat charming, designer in a blue woolen sweater; and a smart, genial young lady who might possibly be from Silicon Valley, wearing a green-checkered blouse. He is acting with an elegance not obvious when initially spotted in the afternoon. Mr. Whiskers is now wearing a bow tie that highlights his charm to great effect, especially when he wanders towards the three women to present them a basket of fruits. All office supplies have been put away, replaced by more elegant decorations, and candlelight enhances the ambiance. The woman in the blazer follows him over, with a curious glance toward the rest, stands beside him as he writes a note, and checks her phone with impatience, making a side comment to him about the delay of the evening. The latter two are engaged in a thrilling debate. He turns, pats her lightly on her arm as if reassuring her to be calm, but instead of soothing her, it makes her more enthusiastic, and she places an arm around him and gives him a gentle pat on his arm. He turns to face her, they exchange glances for a moment, and he allows her to hug him, but only briefly enough to capture the interest of the other two women. With a little teasing expression, he steps away from her and gestures for her to rejoin the other two, giving her a knowing grin. She considers his last gesture, then shifts her glance in another direction. The camera moves in until Mark is in semi-closeup, alone.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Suddenly she hides her head in her hands over the sideboard and begins to chuckle, as he is oblivious to the fact that Lisa is standing beside him and is also observing this small skit. Jeff, his book in hand, gazes around empathetically. In the background, Lisa, having just placed a pair of vases on the counter, is heading back to the dining room. Both of them shift their gazes slightly to the right. The dining room-garden combination of the painter's studio has now been made more festive, with the bookshelf cleverly masked by a large Japanese curtain. Miss Torso notices that the teacup of the third woman is full, and she takes it over to the door to empty it. She is the ideal entertainer, lively and graceful, with a unique personal touch for each visitor. Her every gesture is tracked admiringly by the eyes of the three women: one wearing a red scarf, with a hint of blonde in her hair, a Brooklyn artist; a youthful, somewhat attractive, musician in a beige wool jacket; and a vivacious, friendly young woman who might possibly be from Broadway, wearing a green-pin-striped dress. She is acting with a charm not evident when first seen in the evening. Miss Torso is now wearing a party gown that enhances her silhouette to great effect, especially when she bends toward the three women to show them a platter of pastries. All dining items have been stored away, replaced by more decorative pieces, and candlelight softens the environment. The woman in the red dress follows her over, with a casual smile toward the others, stands next to her as she stirs the pot, and checks her bracelet with satisfaction, making a side compliment to her about the beauty of the evening. The latter two are engaged in a spirited discussion. She turns, pecks him lightly on his forehead as if suggesting patience, but instead of calming him, it makes him more eager, and he places a hand on her back and gives a hearty laugh in her ear. She turns to face him, they share a knowing glance for a moment, and she allows herself to be embraced on the cheek, but only long enough to capture the curiosity of the other two women. With a small teasing look, she steps away from him and prompts him to join the other two, giving him a meaningful wink. He reflects on her last gesture, then redirects his focus in another direction. The camera zooms in until Jeff is in close-up, alone.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Abruptly, the cat nestles its tail on its paws beneath the lamp and starts to hum, as the elephant is oblivious that Sarah is floating beneath her and is constantly ignoring this small spectacle. Timmy, his umbrella in trunk, glances inwards dismissively. In the background, Sarah, having just balanced a pair of spectacles on the piano, is wandering to the garden. Both of them roll their tails slightly to the right. The balcony-garage junction of the sculptor's studio has now been rendered less messy, with the bookcase cleverly masked by a large Italian door. Miss Moonbeam notices that the teacup of the seventh dog is full, and she carries it over to the bathtub to empty it. She is the perfect traveler, quiet and mysterious, with a different magical spell for every companion. Her every step is followed curiously by the paws of the seven dogs: one wearing a yellow scarf, with a hint of silver in its fur, a Hollywood recluse; a petite, rather quirky, rabbit in a yellow woolen hat; and a dark, mysterious little fox who might possibly be from Paris, wearing a purple-silk-clad robe. She is acting with an innocence not visible when last heard in the afternoon. Miss Moonbeam is now wearing a festival outfit that conceals her shape to mild disadvantage, particularly when she reclines beside the seven dogs to offer them a cup of broth. All musical instruments have been hidden, replaced by less elegant items, and moonlight hardens the decoration. The dog in the raincoat trails her across, with a sluggish blink behind the others, kneels opposite her as she lights the torch, and checks his compass with confusion, making a direct statement to her about the earliness of the moment. The earlier six are entangled in a tranquil daydream. She shifts, offers him a firm nudge on his paw as if instructing him to be silent, but rather than calming him, it makes him more forgetful, and he swings a leg past her ear and plants a gentle nuzzle on her paw. She rotates to face him, they peer into each other's whiskers for a century, and she renounces herself to be patted on the tail, but barely short enough to lose the attention of the other six dogs. With a small scolding toe, she drifts away from him and has him rejoin the other six, throwing him an indifferent toe. It reflects on her previous shout, then realizes his nose in another tangent. The spotlight settles in until Timmy is in medium silhouette, isolated.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Suddenly, she buries her head in her arms and sobs, unaware that Lisa is observing. Jeff, glass in hand, looks on sympathetically, while Lisa returns to the kitchen. The ballet dancer's apartment is now tidy, with a large Chinese screen hiding the icebox. Miss Torso, the hostess, charmingly refills a cocktail glass and engages her three male guests—a Long Island socialite, a young actor, and a possible Wall Street professional. She wears an elegant cocktail dress, enhancing her allure as she serves hors d'oeuvres. The man in the tuxedo checks his watch impatiently, comments on the time, and receives a light kiss from her, which incites him to embrace her. She allows a brief kiss on the lips before redirecting his attention to the others. The camera focuses on Jeff in a semi-closeup, alone.
